<root><template><title>RV</title><part><name>type</name>=<value>command

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> arma2

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.00

</value></part><part><name>eff</name>=<value> global

</value></part><part><name>arg</name>=<value> local

</value></part><part><name>gr1 </name>=<value> Remote Control

</value></part><part><name>descr</name>=<value> Switches on remote control of the unit. Command needs to be executed locally to the player.
If driver is remote it will get transferred to players PC.
There is currently no getter command for remote control, but it is possible to use a trick described in Example 3.

</value></part><part><name>s1</name>=<value> who [[remoteControl]] whom

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> who: [[Object]] - controlling unit

</value></part><part><name>p2</name>=<value> whom: [[Object]] - controlled unit

</value></part><part><name>r1</name>=<value> [[Nothing]]

</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> Set player remote control of driver:
<code>[[player]] [[remoteControl]] [[driver]] UAV;
[[driver]] UAV [[switchCamera]] "Internal"; <template><title>cc</title><part><name index="1"/><value>switchCamera required</value></part></template>
<template lineStart="1"><title>cc</title><part><name index="1"/><value>sometimes switchCamera is not needed</value></part></template>
[[player]] [[remoteControl]] [[driver]] UAV;
</code>

</value></part><part><name>x2</name>=<value> Return control to player: <code>[[objNull]] [[remoteControl]] [[driver]] UAV;</code>

</value></part><part><name>x3</name>=<value> A dirty hack to return controlling unit because of the absence of dedicated getter:
<code>SQF_fnc_remoteControlledBy =
{
	[[params]] ["_obj"];
	[[if]] (![[isNull]] [[objectParent]] _obj) [[exitWith]] { [[UAVControl]] _obj [[select]] 0 };
	[[private]] _res = [<ext><name>nowiki</name><attr/></ext>[[objNull]]];
	[[isNil]]
	{
		[[private]] _pos = [[getPosWorld]] _obj;
		[[private]] _dirUp = [<ext><name>nowiki</name><attr/></ext>[[vectorDirVisual]] _obj, [[vectorUpVisual]] _obj];
		[[private]] _anim = [[animationState]] _obj;
		[[private]] _dummy = "PaperCar" [[createVehicleLocal]] [0,0,0];
		_obj [[moveInAny]] _dummy;
		_res = [[uavControl]] _dummy;
		_obj [[setPosWorld]] _pos;
		_obj [[setVectorDirAndUp]] _dirUp;
		_obj [[switchMove]] _anim;
		[[deleteVehicle]] _dummy;
	};
	_res [[select]] 0
};</code>
Usage (could be scheduled or unscheduled):
<code>[] [[spawn]]
{
	[[player]] [[remoteControl]] bob;
	[[systemChat]] [[str]] (bob [[call]] SQF_fnc_remoteControlledBy); <template><title>codecomment</title><part><name index="1"/><value>// B Alpha 1-1:1 (KK)</value></part></template>
	[[objNull]] [[remoteControl]] bob;
	[[systemChat]] [[str]] (bob [[call]] SQF_fnc_remoteControlledBy); <template><title>codecomment</title><part><name index="1"/><value>// <NULL-object></value></part></template>
};</code>

</value></part><part><name>seealso</name>=<value> [[switchCamera]], [[selectPlayer]], [[UAVControl]]
</value></part></template>

<comment><!-- Note Section BEGIN -->
</comment><dt class="note">[[User:TeRp|TeRp]]</dt>
<dd class="note">
You must use [[switchCamera]] in order to remote control a unit.<br>
You can only [[remoteControl]] characters, e.g. if yo want to remote control a car, you have to add a driver and use
 "player remoteControl driver someVehicle".
</dd>

<dd class="notedate">Posted on Jan 25, 2010 - 14:35 (CEST)</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:Lou Montana|Lou Montana]]</dt>
<dd class="note">'''<template><title>arma2</title></template> v1.05''':
* You can remoteControl multiple units at the same time.
* It is not needed to [[switchCamera]] to the unit to be able to control it - it is needed to be able to fire with.
* The switchCamera is fixed : the player can't change internal/external/optics view.
* Do not think about it like a [[selectPlayer]]: it is used to give the control to '''the vehicle role the unit is in'''.
* [[switchCamera]] to the '''vehicle''' the unit is in; the camera will go depending the role you are remoteControlling.
* The AI driver won't follow your vehicle move orders.
* If the player dies, the death screen will appear, not automatically turning back to the player.
* If you want to stop the remote control, use objNull as remote controller.
* Example:
<code>[[player]] [[remoteControl]] [[driver]] jeep1;		<template><title>cc</title><part><name index="1"/><value>will remoteControl it, you still will have full control of the player</value></part></template>
jeep1 [[switchCamera]] "internal";			<template><title>cc</title><part><name index="1"/><value>fix the camera to the ''vehicle'' and not to (driver jeep1) !</value></part></template>
[[waitUntil]] { !([[alive]] jeep1) || !([[alive]] [[player]]) };
[[objNull]] [[remoteControl]] [[driver]] jeep1;		<template><title>cc</title><part><name index="1"/><value>removes the remoteControlling</value></part></template>
[[player]] [[switchCamera]] "internal";			<template><title>cc</title><part><name index="1"/><value>returns to the player</value></part></template></code>

<comment><!-- Note Section END -->
</comment></dl>

<dt class="note">[[User:thedawnofallwars|thedawnofallwars]]</dt>
<dd class="note">
Far and away the easiest way to check the unit remote controlling an  AI is using [[bis_fnc_moduleRemoteControl_owner]]
This will return the unit in question which you can then run name on to find the controller's name.

<code>_who = _unit [[getVariable]] ["bis_fnc_moduleRemoteControl_owner", objNull];
if(![[isNull]] _who) then {
    _name = [[name]] _who;
};</code>
</dd>
